name: Caribbean Pasta with Shrimp
author: LIEBELUNE
summary: A sweet, tangy, spicy shrimp dish. You can prepare the sauces ahead of time and refrigerate.
ingredients: 1  green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 ½ cups tomato - peeled, seeded and chopped
¼ cup brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)
1 ½ pounds medium shrimp - peeled and deveined
directions: In a small bowl, combine garlic, shallots, ginger and oil
In another small bowl, combine green pepper, tomato, curry powder, allspice, chicken stock, Grand Marnier, soy sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, and chile paste
Cover and refrigerate both until ready to use
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
Heat a large saute pan over high
Saute until garlic begins to sizzle but has not browned
Stir the tomato mixture, then pour into the saute pan
Bring to a rapid boil and cook until it begins to thicken, about 3 minutes
Stir in the shrimp, and toss until they become pink, about 2 minutes
Stir and toss until well combined and pasta is heated through
Taste and adjust seasonings, especially salt
Transfer to a heated platter and sprinkle on the cilantro
